report_title: Industry Research: Dermatologists in the US
executive_summary: Rising incomes and broader insurance coverage have facilitated access to dermatology practices in recent years, supporting robust practice growth. While COVID-19 disrupted growth as patient volumes fell in 2020, a jump in healthcare spending and pent-up demand post-COVID offset the drop. Still, the pandemic has had more lasting effects on dermatology practices. COVID-19 has caused more practices to adopt teledermatology, while rising operating costs have accelerated consolidation activity. Revenue has been expanding at a CAGR of 1.0% to an expected $8.7 billion over the past five years. A slowdown in total healthcare spending and recession concerns will slow growth to an estimated 0.5% in 2023.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: COVID-19 created an unprecedented economic crisis, affecting almost all sectors of the US economy. The healthcare sector was particularly affected, and dermatologists were no exception. Dermatologists saw a drop in in-person consultations, surgical services and cosmetic procedures in 2020. A study published by FAIR Health reports that, on average, dermatologists had a 62.0% decrease in usage in March 2020 due to closures, social distancing measures and safety concerns.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: A shift to the group model accelerates
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Rising consolidation activity has shifted the industry's makeup. Independently-operated practices remain the status quo, but multispecialty practices and private equity-backed groups have been on the rise. Fragmentation in dermatology makes the industry ripe for consolidation. An influx of private equity investment spearheads consolidation. Private equity firms invest in dermatology groups, often acquiring smaller, physician-owned practices. PE interest in dermatology has accelerated as a result of rising.
High patient demand for dermatology has led to high-performing practices in recent years, with profit margins averaging an estimated 13.0% in 2023.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Demographic trends will boost healthcare spending
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Dermatology practices will enjoy a rising patient demand for preventative care, surgical treatments and cosmetic procedures. An aging population, rising incomes and expanding private and public insurance coverage will be significant forces driving demand.
Patient demand for dermatological treatments will grow faster than supply moving forward, increasing physician-to-patient ratios.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Financial pressures will ramp up private investment activity and consolidation
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Consolidation activities are expected to accelerate over the next five years.
- More dermatologists will integrate teledermatology into their practices.

industry_definition: This industry includes health practitioners that specialize in diagnosing and treating diseases of the skin, scalp, hair and nails.
key_trends: COVID-19 has had lasting effects on dermatology practices.
Consolidation is changing the landscape of dermatology.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Reimbursements from private payors include payments received from commercial health plans.
Government revenue sources include reimbursements from Medicaid and Medicare.
Out-of-pocket payments include payments by patients or family members for any care not covered by insurance.
Other revenue sources include revenue from healthcare providers for patient care.

products_and_services.product_description: Non-surgical medical treatments include preventative exams, annual visits, skin imaging.
Surgical treatments include diagnosing and treating.
Includes various forms of dermatological care.

tier_2_suppliers: Primary Care Doctors in the US
Brand Name Pharmaceutical Manufacturing in the US
Medical Instrument & Supply Manufacturing in the US
Medical Supplies Wholesaling in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Mohs micrographic surgery is one of the most common surgeries performed at dermatology practices.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Spending on Cosmetic Dermatology is Growing

business_locations.location_description: More than one-quarter of the US population resides in the Southeast region.
The Mid-Atlantic's share of practices mirrors its share of the population.
The West's share of practices falls closely in line with its share of the US population.

regulations_points.regulation_description: Dermatology practices must prove a Certificate of Need before any construction.

regulations_points.regulation_title: The Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act
regulations_points.regulation_description: Dermatology practices must follow all of the criteria of HIPAA.

regulations_points.regulation_title: Anti-Kickback Statute and Physician Self-Referral Laws
regulations_points.regulation_description: The federal Anti-Kickback Statute prohibits the exchange of anything of value.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Labor Shortages Pressure Practices to Pay a Higher Cost for Staff
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Wage costs are the largest expense in 2023, accounting for an estimated 47.4% of revenue.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Wages are highest in metropolitan areas
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Metro areas have high patient demand for dermatological treatments and have higher margins.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Dermatologists are the highest-paid staff in the industry
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: According to the Bureau of Labor Statistics, dermatologists in the top 50th percentile receive an annual salary exceeding $205,000.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Practices rely on a staff of specialists, nurses and nonclinical employees
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Practices rely on a staff of specialists.

FAQs.question: How does your company market itself on online review sites?
FAQs.answer: Advertising on Yelp, Zoc Doc and other review sites can help increase visibility.

FAQs.question: How much does your company allocate to marketing?
FAQs.answer: Typically, dermatology offices spend about 2.0% to 3.0% or less on marketing expenses.
